intro: Relbunium hypocarpium subsp. grandifolium, commonly known as the large-leaved relbunium, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, compound leaves that are often lobed and have a feathery appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural interest.
